author: Nauman Ali
text: 'Fast and fresh. Really filling.'

author: Erik Thrasher
text: 'Good fresh food.  Great stir fry!'

author: Chris V
text: 'Good food
column5: but questionable cleanliness. Honestly one of the most chaotically messy kitchens I‚Äôve ever seen. Stuff everywhere
column6: no masks for people prepping food. I think the staff are stressed out too. Hard to watch.'

author: Benjamin Prosnitz
text: 'My salad was terrible. Candied walnuts
column5: argula
column6: bad chicken and cheese.\n\nUpdate: ordered from them again and it was also bad'

author: Noel Davenport
text: 'The food was great
column5: options good
column6: and friendly. But the point of sale was not my fave.'

author: Alden Pedulla
text: 'Good
column5: healthy food for less than I was expecting.'

author: Anastacia Flores
text: "Food is pretty decent
column5: I do enjoy it. The customer service is always poor
column6: there has never been a time where I've been greeted. If I say have a good day
column7: nobody responds. I've also had an encounter (my FIRST time here) where I did not know where something was and when I asked all I got was someone rudely sigh and point in a direction. No verbal response or eye contact. After a few encounters like this I usually order with the app and just pick up. Most recently upon ordering in person
column8: I was reminded of the poor customer service and how rude the staff screams your name.  Do not respond to this
column9: this is not a one time occurrence
column10: this has been my experience everytime I have come here. The food is great

author: Samantha Masri
text: 'Absolute garbage. Order online
column5: order in store. They don‚Äôt care. They‚Äôll make whatever they feel like and it‚Äôs not what you ordered.'

author: Paul Fratto
text: 'Online orders get lost
column5: don‚Äôt order pick up'

author: Krupali Jhobalia
text: 'The food was less than average'

author: Praveen Shah
text: 'Below average'

author: Divyani Parmar
text: 'I had stir fried take out and I am highly disappointed
column5: it had no taste
column6: I was expecting a good spicy garlic sauce instead It had no taste. :/'

author: Addison Taylor
text: 'This area of Hoboken is blessed with several conscious eating joints. Honeygrow is probably the best of them. Really good
column5: healthy
column6: fresh
column7: food. A bit pricey but you get what you pay for. Sweet staff'

author: J R
text:
'Pros:
Very good food...
Very good music...

Cons:
No personality
No hello
No human interaction'

author: Dan Goldsmith
text: "Has taken a terrible dive. It's basically overseasoned bad Chinese food. I'm done with this place"

author: Danny Joseph
text: 'Hit or miss as others have said. Service
column5: timeliness
column6: and correctness of orders is always a toss up. Workers also not honoring their own mask policies as of mid June 2021. If you‚Äôre not going to wear mask as an employee
column7: then remove your policy. When the food is its best it‚Äôs about an 8
column8: but service and delivery overall 4/10 which makes this place average at best'

author: Michael
text: 'Ordered the same thing 2 days in a row and it was terribly inconsistent. The second day taste like i ordered a different meal. 4 stars on the flavor the first day. Dropped a star for falling off the second'

author: Rashi Prakash
text: 'Horrible food. Ordered a CYO bowl via Uber eats it tasted completely burnt and inedible. It was a dry
column5: dumpy mess of a block of noodles with no sauce
column6: no seasoning and on top of it tasted like I was eating burnt charcoal. I wish I could get refunded for this monstrosity of a meal. Never again'

author: Anthony
text: 'We received dried noodles that was condensed into a huge block. There was almost no sauce or flavor. Also a separate sauce that was paid for was not included in the take-out order.'

author: Michael Roberts
text: 'The employees here are very rude. They gave us the wrong item and the guy on the phone hung up on us 2. Acted like it was our fault they gave us the wrong food. The quality was terrible and so was the service.'

author: Michael M
text: 'The food and selection is incredible! I only hope in the future they add more protein options'

author: Krupali Patel
text: 'I keep coming back to Honeygrow just to eat the delicious pineapples
column5: & roasted cauliflower in the Spicy Garlic stir fry sauce. Love having the stir fry with egg white noodles
column6: and tofu!'

author: cee gonzalez
text: 'nothing sweet but prices will help you grow broke!!!!!!!!!!!  Had a $20.00 bowl to be given a $9 order.  The price is no where near justified for the quality of the product..  Mediocre food at extravagant prices avoid if possible just go to wholefoods.....'

author: Joan Espinoza
text: 'Went here for takeout lunch. Not going to lie the food was very light to your stomach and filling. I ordered a MYO bowl with noodles and apparently should have contained roasted chicken and roasted shrimp with some roasted vegetables. The protein was stone cold and the shrimp was more like the cocktail shrimp texture and like straight out of the fridge. They had a variety of other things to order. The food is enough if you eat average sized meals. Not made to share of if you have a big stomach this is not for you. Their guava strawberry lemonade was pretty good too. Decent place. A little overpriced and the servings are okay. The food needs a little more love. Everything seem to come out of a bag.'

author: Claudia Johnson
text: 'Truly a hit or miss. I order from here often due to it being close to my job. I‚Äôll get an amazing stir fry one day
column5: and a burnt
column6: sauceless stir fry the next. I used to love this place
column7: but after receiving my stir fry today that not only didn‚Äôt include the red coconut curry sauce in my container
column8: but the extra side sauce I paid for
column9: I‚Äôm considering finding a new go to lunch spot.'

author: Catherine C
text: 'The noodles are so delicious!\nApproved by a noddle lover.'

author: Shaun Dacanay
text: "We first had honeygrow in King of Prussia
column5: PA in November 2020. We loved it so much we went twice within two days!\n\nToday
column6: I had the Soy Sesame but added a side of Spicy Garlic sauce. Highly recommend this combination although I would like more heat to the spicy. Can't wait to come back and try their desserts! I was eyeing the cobbler.\n\nTil next time. Here's a photo of their outdoor seating."

author: Andrew Price
text: 'This place used to be on my "The Best Places to Eat in Hoboken" list
column5: but they\'ve gone downhill since the pandemic.\n\nFlavor just isn\'t as it use to be
column6: they cancelled my wife\'s favorite protein (the crumbled turkey - she ordered Turkey Meatballs instead and they tasted off
column7: thankfully they remade the bowl with a different protien)
column8: and I used to look forward to the Maine Root Beer in the soda fountain but they switched to a regular Coca Cola vending machine.\n\nIt\'s all these little things that used to make Honeygrow one of our favorite regular spots to eat
column9: and unfortunately it has lost its pizazz to Covid. üíî'

author: Mimi Benfield
text: "I've been wanting to try Honeygrow for a while so I decided to order cyo chicken stir fry for lunch/brunch
column5: yesterday
column6:
on my birthday.

Within an hour I started having stomach cramps & now it's over 24hrs later & they haven't stopped...amongst other unflattering symptoms.

It's pretty obviously food poisoning."

author: Akshay Singh
text: 'Have been a regular here
column5: for their stir fry.\nThe quality has significantly deteriorated over time.\nThese days
column6: veggies and protein is almost lost in that big lump of noodles.'

author: Annette Pearson
text: 'This was my 1st time eatting here & it was a good experience. I had the Spicy Garlic dish.\nIt was delish! I wish I knew the sodium content though.'

author: Karen N
text: 'Smallest bowl for what you pay for - just walk further up to Quality Kitchen Greens instead.'

author: Brian C
text: 'Today was actual the first day I ever ate at HoneyGrow in Hoboken
column5: NJ. I must say the stir fry I got w/ Shrimp
column6: chicken & beef was very tasteful!!! The customer service was excellent & fast!! I recommend this place to everyone!'

author: Angel Ramos
text: 'üòç'

author: CJ
text: "Excellent quality and tasty salads. I love the ordering screens inside
column5:
they're really easy to use.

The acai / fruit bowls are good but a little small for what you pay for.

Super friendly staff. Clean
column6: modern facility.\n\nRecommended."

author: Vanessa Pintinho
text: 'Healthy and fast food. After a weekend eating pretty much fast food
column5: it was great!'

author: Jack Tolkien
text: 'I got the shrimp bowl!! Great choice yet!!!! Spices are really great'

author: Aparna Regunathan
text: 'I ordered their Custom noodle bowl with Tofu and veggies. The taste was absolutely great and flavorful. The only thing that disappointed me was that the food was extremely oily. It was dripping in oil. Also i found it a bit expensive. I would recommend trying their spicy garlic sauce'

author: Kathryn Manley
text: 'I love this place! I suffer from Irritable bowel syndrome
column5: and my diet is extremely limited
column6: bland and boring.  I discovered honeygrow a little while back and i love it! If i need the order modified to fit my annoying diet needs
column7: they always do it. Im obsessed with the tofu and rice noodles. Sooo tasty!'

author: Sohil Gandhi
text: 'Amazing stir fry noodles'

author: Melanie Rosen
text: 'This place was a lot of fun. You go up to a computer and pick out what kind of food bowl you want.  There are so many choices. The atmosphere is casual.'

author: Chelsea Phu
text: 'I had the BLT salad with spicy ranch dressing. I have no idea what dressing they gave me but it didn‚Äôt taste like ranch at all. It tasted like heavy cream with spice added to it. It kinda tasted like they straight up milked it from the cow‚Äôs utter
column5: churned it to make it thick
column6: then added some spicy stuff. I like the spice but the taste of the heavy cream that was supposedly ~ranch~ ruined the dressing and the meal. I will give 1 star for the fresh lettuce and 1 star for the abundant bacon bits. Maybe I‚Äôll order it again and hope that the dressing situation was just a mistake
column7: then change this review. But i don‚Äôt see myself ordering an expensive salad only to receive imperfection. Also
column8: I ordered through UberEats and was unable to remove the blue cheese. So I am typing this as my lactose intolerant stomach is tightening up. If they give me a voucher for the same salad and it‚Äôs fixed up
column9: I‚Äôll change the review. But fix the UberEats app options :)'

author: Sree Sadineni
text: 'Loved this place. Their stir fry rice noodle was amazing. Lots of options for veggie selection and their tofu was üôåüèª. Totally recommend this place.\n\nThanks Honeygrow for making me a delicious meal.'

author: Chao Wu
text: 'Quick and easy to order.'

author: Fahid Khawaja
text:
'Salad not washed with mold growing on it. Completely unacceptable. Threw out the whole salad.

Red coconut curry noodles had plastic bits in it.

Will never order from here again.'

author: Anthony Mahone
text: "Great place if you're craving stir fry. Choose from one of their combinations or build your own. Different kinds of noodles
column5: rice
column6: vegetables
column7: meats/poultry/meatless
column8: and sauces."

author: almeria campbell
text: "I don't eat out much because I cook and most dining out food is just okay but honey....this was something delicious! Never have I ever had a  creamy noodle dish at a restaurant
column5: this tasty. This only happens at family or friends houses. You get 5 stars on that."

author: Daryl Krasnuk
text: "I have ordered from this place in the past and it was always very good. This time I ordered a stir fry and was absolutely horrible
column5: I couldn't even eat it. The noodles were so over done that they were mushy and clumped together. There was also way too much sauce and very few vegetables. It was very disappointing to say the least."

author: Justice-Keith Monroe
text: 'Pre-Pandemic... spending $16 for a salad was okay
column5: when it‚Äôs worth it. However
column6: Post -Pandemic
column7: i returned after the gym to get a salad
column8: and the girl prepping the salad didn‚Äôt even toss it. Just put it in a bowl. The results
column9: a huge clump of chicken breasts that tastes as if it was bad. The service isn‚Äôt what it‚Äôs used to be
column10: but I‚Äôll blame it on the Corona blues that we all have. I can eat around the big clump of chicken breast
column11: and enjoy the salad. I can almost excuse the poor service. But I‚Äôll go to subway for a salad for the for the same amount of service with a little more effort'

author: Franklin Cedillo
text: 'The stir fry is delicious and a must try!!'

author: Jui Pendharkar
text: 'Overall the taste was good. But the reason for giving 3 stars is my dishes had a LOT of noodles and very few pieces of veggies
column5: tofu
column6: chicken. I had ordered two dishes and even paid extra to add broccoli
column7: edamame and chicken. Even then i had to search through a pile of noodles to get to a few pieces of veggies that were added. Ratio of noodles vs other ingredients was opposite to what they display in their pictures. Very disappointing.'

author: shrikrishna111
text: "Taste and quality was nice. Lots of veggies option. But the quantity is less. Serving quantity in my regular order is same as my kids bowl. Container is half filled. It can't satisty adults. Also
column5: I paid 55 cents extra for each veggies and just get 1 or 2 piece of veggie."

author: Alyssa Carolyn
text: 'Delicious food and amazing service!!! Shout out to Josh
column5: Alex
column6: and Deno for being so so helpful
column7: kind
column8: and making my experience at honeygrow so wonderful!'

author: Kenya Smalls
text: 'I love this location so so so much!!!  Joanna Josue  and Sharon made my Jersey experience perfect!!! Food was on Point !!!'

author: Postflop Malone
text: 'I really like salads in general so I order from here a lot. But like half the time my bowl is only 2/3 full which is really unsatisfying
column5: and sometimes there‚Äôs not enough dressing as well
column6: and I don‚Äôt wanna be annoying and ask them to add more especially since the staff appears to be working really hard so I don‚Äôt ask
column7: but this shouldn‚Äôt be happening in the first place :('

author: Marbe Mitteregger
text: 'Nice!!'

author: Kollin Quinn
text: 'I love y‚Äôall but y‚Äôall gotta stop changing the menu. I get that you have seasonal items but the menu changes to frequently I don‚Äôt bother ordering because when I go on your website the dishes I like and are use to are already gone.'

author: Gregory Jacobs
text: 'We‚Äôve been ordering delivery from Honeygrow for a quite bit now
column5: but unfortunately just about every other order we don‚Äôt get any dressing for the salad or sauce for the stir fry bowl
column6: even though we pay extra for it to be on the side.\n\nWe‚Äôve managed to scrounge up things in the past to put on the salad/bowls when this has happened (olive oil
column7: soy sauce
column8: etc.)
column9: but this time we‚Äôre out of those things.\n\nReceiving a dry salad is incredibly disappointing. Then when you try to call them about it
column10: they don‚Äôt pick up. We used to really enjoy Honeygrow

author: Lauren Eckert
text: 'I‚Äôve gone to this honeygrow twice in the past two weeks and they messed up my order both times. The first time they forgot to add chicken to the salad
column5: and the second time they forgot to add two toppings that I paid extra for. Unfortunately I didn‚Äôt realize my order was messed up until after I got back to my apartment both times. Honestly super disappointed given that I‚Äôm paying $14 for a salad..... update they just messed up my order again. Forgot the protein. Plus the bowl was 75% full.'

author: Suzette Austin
text: 'I love honey grow I usually go to the one in Delaware . I so I decide to give Hoboken  try\nbad experience. I order the shrimps and paid extra for the chicken and I also got kale
column5: broccoli
column6: carrots
column7: string beans.this was a week ago I understand were in a pandemic. But I expect to get a full container not less then half I only had two shrimps in my container no chicken no kale and if you call that carrots and two broccoli I never had this problem in Delaware.you guys have to step your game up'

author: Julia Kee
text: 'Great place to make your own stir-fry (or salad!) Line can be long during peak hours (lunch and dinner) but worth it for a delicious dinner that you can really customize however you see fit!'

author: Renee Roman
text: 'Great place to eat for those that are environmentally conscious because they also offer vegan and gluten-free options.\nThey offer a very wide array of high quality options for dishes and are reasonably priced. Have everything a customer would need
column5: napkins
column6: utensils
column7: lids and bags for take away
column8: an array of sauces including hot sauce even chopsticks.\n\nThe restaurant is always clean and welcoming new customers to sit and eat or prepare for take away.'

author: Jolyn Villanueva
text: 'No point on ordering online. I arrived 15 minutes after order and nobody had even started my order. I informed staff that I had arrived. She looked at my order and told me 5 minutes. 10 minutes later nobody had even looked at my order. So 40 mins for online order.'

author: Joe M
text: 'Very overrated and overpriced.  Small portion
column5: beef was super chewy
column6: barely any ingredients in the stir fry.  Crazy how the reviews here are so good.'

author: Manan Shah
text: 'Unique place and must try for salad lovers. Have healthy options and they all come in stir-fry (much better than usual salad :-D) Many option for vegetarian people too. Will definitely recommended .'

author: Mitul patel
text: 'Best stir fries i ever had ... This place is clean and food is awesome... customer service is bit ok but rather than that its all good ...'

author: Saja Wagle
text: 'This place you don‚Äôt have to compromise taste for Healthy food'

author: Andy Benavides
text: "Delicious and spicy if you're into that"

author: Peter Musolino
text: 'Easy to order and pretty tasty'

author: Jo Hayes
text: "A little overpriced but fast and very tasty! Great for if you have a group that's balancing different dietary requirements."

author: Mel M
text: "Not a place to unwind when working. Music was blaring and
column5: when asked if they would turn it down the employee couldnt hear me over it. Once emphatic
column6: he said he would try he best but it remained blaring. Get food to go
column7: even out in cold fresh air is better. Good food
column8: hard workers annoying kiosk...better if the'd welcome us to show us the option that you can order via person if you pass the kiosks."

author: Danielle Simonetti
text: 'Wasn‚Äôt impressed with my first experience. The online site that they make you sign up with to order online lead to two spam emails being sent to me right after I received the confirmation. The food itself wasn‚Äôt great. The spinach noodles was swimming in sauce and ruined the whole entree. Ended up throwing it out.'

author: Thomas Fahy
text: 'Great stir fry'

author: Kush Patel
text: 'Decide to dine here on a Friday night. We waited for really really long time to get our food. It felt like the take out orders were prepared way faster. Plus when the food came out the noodles were cold (maybe they forgot to give it to me?) I had to ask them to reheat. Not really impressed'

author: Kinjal Gala
text: 'Awesome organic food
column5: best for a quick dinner place ..'

author: Otis Duffy
text: 'Great place and food'

author: Vivek Chandwani
text: 'Great food'

author: Jeffrey Mejia
text: 'Awesome noodles
column5: cooked to order
column6: delish and fresh'

author: Jeanette O
text: 'This place was good. I felt one dish lacked flavor; curry stir fry. It had some heat
column5: but once I got home with my take out I added curry paste. My sister‚Äôs dish was much better. She chose to make her own bowl with chicken and zucchini noodles. Hers tasted great! Both came out to be about $20 or so. Decent portions. I will most definitely choose my own next time instead of an already made bowl.'

author: Amy Ma
text: 'Amazing food. Love the stir fry here!'

author: Steph Sugar
text: 'Tasty meals that are easy on the bank and my waistline :)'

author: Arelys Priede
text: 'A bit pricey but good food'

author: g jones

author: Dani Mor
text: 'It was better in the past... Now there are alternatives in Hoboken'

author: Tom Doody
text: 'impressive ordering computer w gr8 pics of PROTEIN only problem is PROTEIN is scarce in the oversized bowls sm portion gr8 if u have an eating disorder'

author: alex serra
text: 'Over priced'

author: David
text: 'Pretty overpriced! The two times I‚Äôve been to HG
column5: they‚Äôve been out of ingredients??  The salads here are decent
column6: but otherwise there are a lot of better alternatives in Hoboken. Be forewarned

text: 'Great experience; Luke is the best
column5: dude.'

author: Jaclyn Bellizzi Robert
text: 'Great vegan options!'

author: Savannah
text: 'The food is pretty good here. The only reason I‚Äôm giving it 4 stars is due to their lack of vegan options on the menu and the and fact that they don‚Äôt  give reusable silverware and provide other sustainable items.'

author: Ivelisse Diaz
text: 'Food contained so much flavor!'

author: BJ Guz
text: 'The coconut curry stir fry is the absolute best!!!! If you go during the summer months bring a sweater
column5: its always freezing in there. I eat outside even if its 90 degrees because I can never eat comfortably inside due to how dang cold it is!'

author: Sally Elias
text: 'Everything time I come here I always like what I get. A tad in the pricier side
column5: but the ingredients are a lot better than your average place.'

author: Arda kabaklƒ±
text: 'Very delicious and nice ordering'

author: Georgette Cantler
text: 'So YUMMY
column5: clean restaurant'

author: uhm ok
text: "When the food is cooked by the right people
column5: everything comes out amazing! From my experience
column6: it's best to go on weekends. That's when the food tasted the best."

author: Mike Altieri
text: 'Great lunch spot!'

author: reshma srinivas
text: 'I Love Honeygrow but i was so disappointed with my order today. I ordered a take away stir fry
column5: and there was no NOODLES IN IT !!!?? How can they even make it an order and give it that way ?! Was so shocked to open my box and literally see just sauce floating around !!!!'

author: Uttam Kedia
text: 'Great place to eat healthy food.  customize your food based on your taste there.'

author: Dhruv Patel
text: 'Great food quality'

author: Ana T
text: 'My favorite casual food. I always feel great after a meal here
column5: I love the red curry and all of the salad combinations.'

author: Joseph Alminawi
text: "Excellent quality salad place. Put in your order and pay via kiosk - then wait for your name to be called. Can get busy at lunch but they generally work very fast. You do get the impression that they are trained to welcome you - and while it doesn't always sound genuine - I personally appreciate the effort. They also have stir fry and dessert bowls that are fantastic. Typically a salad is super filling already - but occasionally I'll go back for pineapple topped with cream
column5: granola and Nutella."

author: Carter Anne
text: "I was honestly surprised when I came here by how delicious all the food was. You just pick what you want on a screen and it gets made for you according to how you like it. It's a fun concept which I enjoy with great food. Can't beat that!"

author: Neil
text: "Honeygrow is awesome because you can order food without talking to anyone. And some days
column5: isn't that all you really need?\n\nThe food quality here is A+. There are tons of spicy sauces and the high tech screens allow you to customize to your heart's delight. Although it creepily asks for your phone number each time you place an order (I mean these days
column6:
who doesn't know your phone number) the process is seamless.

I love the seasoned turkey bowl with extra spicy miso.

Only complaint - wait times sometimes can be ~10 minutes
column7: but at least it gives you some downtime to reflect on your life and whether Hoboken is the Manhattan of New Jersey or whether Manhattan is the Hoboken of New York. Either way
column8: you're still boarding a crowded train."

author: Roxanne Connelly
text: 'Excellent place to eat.'

author: Sean Whelan
text: 'Great food and fast service'

author: little bit from everything
text: 'This very nice
column5: clean place. What i order which noddle shrimp
column6: brokoli was so delicious. How you give an order
column7: smart!!! You just go to the touch screen
column8: you get what you want
column10: buy it just in peace. I am giving 4 star because
column11: the portion size is good but price is little bit high.'

author: sir epii
text: 'Great food
column5: fast and always satisfies.'

author: Marna Garces
text: 'Delicious'

author: Fiona Stout
text: 'Great vegan options'

author: Navindra Singh
text: 'I had a custom salad here a couple days ago.  The salad had a bit too much dressing and inconsistencies with the ingredients I chose for it.  For example
column5: there was a very few walnuts and a large piece of avocado along with two tiny pieces of roasted broccoli.  The salad was not well balanced with respect to ingredients. The cashier seem to have to remind the preparer as to what ingredients needed to be in the salad so there‚Äôs no proper system or coordination of what ingredients should be in the salad when ordered.  Overall it was a fairly okay experience with obviously healthy food choices.'

author: Milly
text: 2 years ago
column6: 'The food was awesome ! Thanks to the employee for caring for my opinion !'

author: Megha Kalia
text: 'Freshness of their ingredients makes the experience great. Highly recommend it to all'

author: Wajiha Dawood
text: 'Great
column5: healthy choices and ingredients are fresh. In app order ahead is the best thing they‚Äôve come up with. Food is delicious'

author: Sarah Fisher
text: 'Not sure why this place is so busy. Service is sub par
column5: bordering on rude. I have not experienced it first hand but have witnessed others. I would recommend going somewhere else.  The food here isnt worth the attitude.'

author: Jos√©e Paquette
text: 'The vegan bowl was really tasty but the curry was absolutely bland and empty. A bit pricy for the portion size.'

author: Tony Sethi
text: 'Loved the food. Wish portions were a little more. It was delicious. Clean place. Will visit again.'

author: Sayali Upasani
text: 'They have really good stir fry options. The spicy tofu  is really good. #vegetarianfriendly'

author: Karen Mathura
text: 'Great taste.'

author: ROCCO Romano
text: 'Good food a bit overpriced and service is erratic.'

author: Mike Mariniello
text: 'Great salads'

author: Hatem Gawaly
text: 'A bit pricey but fresh and relatively quick'

author: Abhinai Pothireddy
text: 'Good but moderatly pricey'

author: Nick H-G
text: 'Awesome good. Great experience'

author: Douglas Marques dos Santos
text: 'Tasty'

author: Levi
text: 'Numerous good options'

author: Will Carpenter
text: "Food I would define as ok. Not good but ok. Portion size definitely not worth the money. Waited 20 minutes to get food. Received a text that my food was ready 12 minutes prior to it actually being ready. When I went to get my food the guy said it would be right up so was forced to wait and watch the hectic process. Food wasn't always made in the order it was received which is frustrating. Anyway wouldn't recommend based on my experience."

author: Rachel Bien
text: 'Our experience at the Hoboken Honeygrow gets more and more frustrating. Although the food is good the experience is awful and inconsistent. When we first starting going to honeygrow about a year ago they were efficient
column5: accurate
column6: kind and fast. Now they are sloppy
column7: rude and slow. They consistent forget something from our order and use the wrong ingredients that we selected for our create your own meals. Today we orders on the mobile app for pick up and after my boyfriend walked back home with our meals
column8: the lettuce cup that is the base of my entire meal was missing. He proceeded to walk back to the restaurant to be greeted with NO apology and rude judgement when he asked for a bag. I really love the food but given this constant disappointment I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôll be returning to honeygrow until they fix their operational pitfalls and staffing.'

author: Jayne Freeman
text: 'Everything here is so fresh & tasty! I could live on their salads - if only there was a location in Jersey City!'

author: Sarah Apicella
text: 'Yum'

author: Meredith Henry
text: 'This place is a staple for me. I love the salads
column5: but don‚Äôt like the wait. I never know how long I will need to stand around.'

author: peter liu
text: 'Great restaurant with very healthy food. Both of the salad and stir fry are tastes good with high quality.'

author: sun shine
text: "I tried Stir fry and loved it that I don't even try anything else.  Now the noodles are not tender (they are hard) sometime actually very hard."

author: Riteeka g
text: 'A new experience....'

author: Jerry Wohlgemuth
text: "I really want this to be a go to place
column5: but it's so inconsistent. I've had really good and really bad stir fry here. Pictured is a particularly bad one: burned
column6: about half the usual portion
column7: and barley any sauce."

author: Brett Hladczuk
text: 'Try and find a better salad place
column5: I dare you. And they have organic tables??? Don‚Äôt even get me started... seriously don‚Äôt
column6: because I‚Äôll have to wait in line for 20 minutes to get it.'

author: Kevin Rezvani
text: 'A littl pricey but the food is really good. Def worth it. Just started being a vegan recently and this is a great option'

author: Fabio Almeida
text: 'Pricy for the quality of the food.'

author: Alyssa T
text: 'I ordered from them off of Grubhub and I always had a pleasant experience but this time was awful. I recived a half filled Saratoga water bottle so someone had to of opened it and then put it in the bag. I ordered their ‚Äúhoney bar‚Äù with ‚ÄúNutella honey‚Äù and all they gave me was a cup of Nutella for $6.00 dollars.... how does that even happen?'

author: William Blankley
text: "Clean
column5: friendly staff and good food. Can't go wrong!"

author: a kpec
text: "I've been working in Hoboken for almost 2 years and finally stumbled in for a take out lunch from Honey Grow. What a disaster. The staff were working as hard as they could
column5: and they were performing well considering the circumstances. But it's clear management or the owners do not respect the time of their customers. It took 41 minutes from the time my order was processed on the electronic kiosk to the time they handed me my take out. The kitchen is not large enough to handle the volume of orders that the restaurant is taking in. I don't even know how to fix this problem other than having some sort of wait time estimate at the kiosk before you order so you know what you're in for. The owners don't care. They get their profit. If I'm going to wait 40 minutes for my food
column6: I'll go somewhere where my time and money are respected. Tough to be those employees for sure."

author: Victoria Pawar
text: 'Really different place to eat
column5: really enjoyed the food and the diverse choices!'

author: Bruce Ornstein
text: 'Nice salads.  Over priced.'

author: Joel Velez
text: 'Clean place
column5: good food
column6: and a great environment. However
column7: the reason I‚Äôm giving the restaurant 3 stars is because they constantly mess up my order. They seem to always miss an item. I live a half hour from the restaurant and coming home to a missing ingredient is a big let down. I‚Äôm hoping this can improve because this is one of my favorite restaurants!'

author: Desiree Velez
text: 'Horrible service
column5: !!!!!!!!!!!!\nOrdered food online
column6: not only did the order take over 2+ hrs there‚Äôs was no  courtesy call to notify me for the delay ..... I called several times to speak to a manager and got hung up on .... poor service take your business else we‚Äôre theres many great options on this lovely town of Hoboken !'

author: Firdavsii Majidzoda
text: 'There is no better food in the area. However they kept messing up my order every time. Opening the bag at home and you find out something is missing in your order. Sometimes I kept an eye on my honeybar and reminded them to put stuff they about to skip. And free items on your birthday is just a false promise. Too bad a place like this starting out very good is loosing quality now. You just lost a gold status customer.'

author: Matt Olsen
text: 'The girl named Jaileen was amazing at her job with making my salad just the way I wanted It
column5: not too much of anything and she kept the balance precise and well mixed as well
column6: she literally nailed it on the head with with it ü§óü§óüëçüëçüëç'

author: Zuhal Ta≈ü
text: 'The place is clean
column5: the food tastes good and i liked their self order system. But what i didn‚Äôt like at all is you can‚Äôt find what‚Äôs in the salad dressings at the place. There isn‚Äôt any information about what the dressings‚Äô ingredients are. That really annoyed me. I need to know what i am eating. What if i have an allergy to one of the ingredients? There is only one general warning about peanuts. But what about other food allergies? And one other important thing for me is how many calories the dressing has. No information. The guy at the register said that you can find it on the website. It wasn‚Äôt easy to find but i found the calorie chart for the dressing as i was ready to eat my food waiting in front of me.. The ingredient information isn‚Äôt on the same page
column6: so it took 5 minutes to find the ingredients too.. i hated that they don‚Äôt have the list for the dressings at the restaurant.'

author: Jake Redman
text: 'Great
column5: healthy eats!'

author: Peter Garncarz
text: 'Ive spent over $150 in one week on this place. Every time ive had food from  honeygrow
column5: they have messed my order up. Today i paid 1.50 extra for ovacado and it was barley enough to feed an ant. Yesterday when they messed my order up
column6: the cook threw my food on the shelf because he had to remake it. Another time i have been given an open water bottle that was drank out of.  Discusting!  Managment didnt care about the customer. Honestly for the price this place cost they  shouldnt be messing up. Im done eating here and ill take my business somewhere else'

author: Helene Avraham
text: "Food is decent. I've tried salads and stirfries. Main issue is wait for food. Too long a wait for lunch. Don't they know I need to get back to work? Also
column5: a colleague tried to save time by preordering online and they messed up her order a couple of times. Weird because you order on an iPad in the store!"

author: Melanie Tam
text: "Since moving to Hoboken
column5: I had been wanting to try Honeygrow. I hadn't yet because it was a bit of a walk from where a live. Fast forward to one Sunday
column6: when my BF and I were walking around trying to decide what to eat for lunch. We wanted something relatively healthy
column7: and that's when he pointed out HoneyGrow.\n\nOnce you walk in
column8: it's a self-ordering system. They have a few stations where you can pick what you want and customize it to exactly how you like it. I went with the summer seasonal item
column9: the Chesapeake Crab (noodles (+50 cents for wheat)
column14: and swapped the bell pepper for bean sprouts). It was served in this tomato brothy sauce
column15: which was packed with flavor. They also gave a generous helping of crab
column16: which I did not expect. I enjoyed every bite
column17: especially with some Sriracha sauce. BF got the Sweet Soy Five Spice (brown rice
column21: sesame seeds). He liked his too but his portion looked small - smaller than mine at least.\n\nMy favorite thing about Honeygrow is that the menu items are customizable. If there's a menu item you like but an ingredient in there that you don't
column22: you can easily swap it out. If that's still not your thing
column23: you can always create your own stir fry. Be prepared to wait though. We waited about 15 minutes before our food was finally ready. But it was worth the wait."

author: Steven Hoffenson
text: 'Great spot for fresh
column5: healthy (depending on what you order) food that tastes good. Lately
column6: it has been taking a VERY long time to get served. Last time I stood and watched my completed dish sit for 10 minutes while waiting for the (not entirely busy) staff to put it on a tray and call my number.'

author: The Laughing Pleb
text: "Really fantastic stir fry
column5: the music was so loud that I couldn't hear my phone in an empty restaurant. I was their third customer
column6: so it was still really early. No idea why they need to blast it."

author: James Glover
text: 'Great
column5: fresh
column6: and tasty option!'

author: Jordan Silva
text: 'I really enjoyed the food
column5: it‚Äôs very delicious and healthy
column6: about a 10-20min wait depending on how busy they are
column7: but worth the wait.'

author: Liat Rosenberg
text: 'Good
column5: fresh
column6: fast
column7: nice staff'

author: Adam Poller
text: 'Excellent service here!'

author: Philipp Molzer
text: 'The food is pretty good and the ordering system is fun.'

author: Eman Azzam
text: 'Perfect place to get some good
column5: fast
column6: fresh
column7: and clean grub.'

author: Rob Dezendorf
text: 'Delicious healthy options

author: Mayank Nema
text: 'Egg noodles were pathetic'

author: Sina M
text: 'One of my favorite on the go spots to get a healthy meal in.'

text: "Really tasty

text: 'Consistently good and healthy food.'

text: 'Food is healthy but very blend at the same time i have tried different different vegan and vegetarian places and this one is ok in taste wise otherwise if u r not about spices and all and this place is ok'

author: Maria
text: 'I stopped in yesterday just to try it. Ordered a quick snack from the honey bar. It was delicious. I mean I could eat it everyday kind of delicious. I was really intrigued by the menu as well. I can‚Äôt wait to go back and try something else.'

author: Connie Pelina Lueken
text: "Loved this quick & healthy spot and you're able to customize your order easily."

author: Mawel Soler
text: 'Have it a tried and it was worth it. Built my own salad good choices of ingredients and bigger than normal size. Def recommend it.'

author: World Wide Wiggz
text: 'Everything is perfect! We need more locations'

author: Nora McGlynn
text: 'I really loved this place! It has a pretty calm vibe despite being pretty busy every weeknight. It is on the expensive side but you know that it will be walking down Washington. Its easy ordering using the touch screen
column5: and the wait is short. There is usually enough turnaround where you do not have to wait for a table. Its also a good go-to for when you want to eat alone but not take out.'

author: Amanda Fossati
text: 'Average salad. I did like that I was able to order from an iPad and there were tons of customizations.'

author: Bryce
text: 'It just took them 30 minutes to make a noodle bowl...'

author: Timothy Wearne
text: 'Great food...price is fair..can make your own meals up'

author: Mikhail Druzhinin
text: '17 min to make a salad is too much
column5: fire salad guy'

author: Nikki Whitney
text: 'Love the food

author: Kartik Parekh
text: 'The food tastes good... but the prices are very high imo and quantity is super less.'

author: Nidhish D
text: 'Good place for quick bite.'

author: Sym Cardnel
text: 'Great salads...'

author: Koro Chan
text: 'So much to choose from and enjoy. Love the Honey & Fruit cups here.'

author: Rebecca Juras
text: "Think of Chipotle but with noodles and rice or a salad. Choose your ingredients and they'll stir fry and mix it all together in a bowl for you. My only complaint is that their meat could be of better quality or maybe just cooked better. Several times when I first tried them out
column5: it was either tough and too chewy or just plain fatty. I'm glad I kept coming back though. I stick with vegetarian bowls now and find myself craving it multiple times a week. I love combining their rice noodles and red curry sauce with whatever veggies suit my fancy each time. Definitely would recommend this place! Delicious!"

author: Yuri Kyrpach
text: 'Healthy food
column5: very good.'

author: Gina Amesbury
text: "They were very friendly here and there's a good menu selection. I really like the digital ordering and the choices they give you to compile. The only problem I had was I paid for cashews and got no cashews and the steak was rock hard
column5: it bent my fork. The only thing was the noodles or cold on one side and mostly warm on the bottom but once you mix it together or they were edible temperature. I was just a little inconsistent.  Nice atmosphere but there were a bunch of burnt out light bulbs.  I would go back though"

author: Marc Pagliarulo
text: 'Great food amazing staff great cooks'

author: Pat Coleman
text: "Good consistent stirfry and salads that use healthy ingredients. Healthier than most places nearby
column5: but wait time can get long if you don't order ahead on their app."

author: Janelle Ferraro
text: "Delicious
column5: I got the red curry noodles and swapped tofu for beef. Spicy but good. Can't wait to go back."

author: D Gilligan
text: 'Great selection of dishes\nService? Eh.'

text: 'Great healthy foods.'

author: Diego QR
text: 'Great place to dine out. The tablet interface is intuitive and the price for the product is worth it. Highly recommend the soy chili sauce to top your noodles.'

text: 'Delicious!'

text: 'You can place your order using touch screen and also make the payment yourself. Sitting area is nice too'

text: 'Very interesting decor
column5: friendly staff
column6: Place has a modern feel. Food is good
column7: l would visit again.'

author: Bedaba Attia
text: 'To slow'

author: Steve A
text: "One of my favorite places to eat
column5: I even travel about 30min just to eat here.  But unfortnately today will be my last day.  I said to myself what is my important  my craving for this place or my health.  Here is what happened today. I arrived tonight
column6: ordered my usual and saw that the entire staff was cleaning already and it was only 8:30pm.  They were cross contaminating everything
column7: cleaning with up with vacuums
column8: sweeping up dirty floor water with broom while throwing speckles of that dirty water into the food prep station which contains all the vegetables
column11: etc.  They need to hire a new crew with a more competent manager.  I witness this place from being one of my go to places to eat but I saw it slowly becoming more and more a place I wouldn't even recommend anymore.  The owners need to be more aware of the locations and pay more attention to the condition
column12: everything is falling apart from the gate door
column14: and bathroom smells disgusting.  Even the prep station is always a mess with food everywhere in all corners where i witness an employee just knock the food back into random trays which will explain once when i got a piece of chicken in my tofu dish
column15: made me really upset since I am a vegan.  My advice to owners is that you guys need to have a new manager to over look the crews
column16: and also for the owners to have weekly visits and to see for themselves if they would be proud of what this place is becoming."

author: Matthew Hartsough
text: 'Stir fry OMG'

text: 'Super good and vegan options available'

author: Jeff N
text: "Healthy
column5: organic
column6: a bit pricey
column7: service a bit slow but they double check the orders. Metal seats and stationary barstools
column8: wood benches
column10: but earthy. Interesting music.  Long lines
column11: surprised the tech generations take so long at the menu kiosks which are big touch screens with pictures.  That's where you order
column12: otherwise no human contact except for a greeter most of the time
column13: who also comes by the dining area sometimes to ask how you're liking the food.  I come back because it is delicious and good for you. Everything is locally sourced and organic."

author: Jeremie Pettit
text: "This place used to be my favorite
column5: but just witnessed a cook coming back behind the counter after handling his phone which he put back in his back pocket
column6: then went directly back to cooking and handling food without changing his gloves. Disgusted
column7: I immediately demanded a refund and left.\n\nThis is not the first time I've witnessed incompetence from this staff
column8: although it is the first time I saw something this disgusting. Everyone knows phones have more germs than toilet seats."

author: Kirk Visser
text: "It's got decent salads and stir fry."

text: 'Place is my goto lunch spot if im in the hoboken area plus the fact that theyll cook my stir fry with no oil is a win win!!!'

text: 'it was my 4th time having a salad in "honeygrow" in Hoboken and as usual i took SPRINGTHAI\'M . it was TOO SPICY and i\'ve decided to tell  the manager Angelo about it. Surprise! he did not care and did not want to give me a new one therefore i gave him my salad back and offered to eat it himself. one more thing - the restaurant smells like heavily chlorine swimming pool! NEVER AGAIN i would buy a salad there!'
